Subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Add and recrawl seeds during a crawl

X-Yahoo-Profile: laurendko
From: "Ko, Lauren" <lauren.ko@...>

If you have added a URL as a seed via a .seeds file but it was already craw=
led, though it is not re-crawled automatically, it is then used in scoping =
as a seed. You could then force it to be re-crawled by using a .force file =
(https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Action+Directory), and t=
he second time it is crawled, it will be treated as a seed. To add URLs via=
 the .force file, lines should start with "F+ " like:
F+ http://example.com=


One thing to note in doing this, if URLs discovered in the recrawl of the=
 "new" seed have already been crawled, they will not be recrawled, so depen=
ding on what your goals in recrawling are, this way of achieving it may not=
 be good for you.

Perhaps there is overall a better way that someone will =
share.

Lauren Ko
UNT Libraries
________________________________________
Fr=
om: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]
Sent:=
 Monday, February 29, 2016 1:54 PM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subj=
ect: [archive-crawler] Add and recrawl seeds during a crawl

Hello,


I'm n=
ew to Heritrix and I'm trying to figure out if it's possible to add a seed =
in a running crawl and crawl it even if it was already crawled. I've read t=
his topic<https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-crawler/conversations=
/messages/8537> that explains how to add a seed in mid-crawl, which works f=
ine, but if I add a seed already crawled Heritrix just ignores it. Is there=
 a way to make Heritrix crawl it again?
